etymology.description: 串(串) (chuàn, "skewer") refers to food threaded on sticks, 香(香) (xiāng, "fragrant") describes the enticing aroma and flavor. Together, 串串 refers to the skewered items in hotpot, which are known for their fragrance.
etymology.interpretation: 串串香, often associated with Sichuan cuisine, is a type of hot pot where various skewered foods are cooked in a flavorful and aromatic broth, reflecting the popular social dining experience and rich flavors typical of the region.

examples.chinese: 串串香是一种受欢迎的街头小吃(串串香是一種受歡迎的街頭小吃)。
examples.pinyin: Chuàn chuàn xiāng shì yī zhǒng shòu huānyíng de jiētóu xiǎochī.
examples.english: Skewered hot pot is a popular street snack.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃串串香(我喜歡吃串串香)，因为它辣味十足(因爲它辣味十足)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī chuàn chuàn xiāng, yīnwèi tā làwèi shízú.
examples.english: I like to eat skewered hot pot because it is wonderfully spicy.

examples.chinese: 冬天的时候(冬天的時候)，一碗热气腾腾的串串香可以驱寒(一碗熱氣騰騰的串串香可以驅寒)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān de shíhòu, yī wǎn rèqì téngténg de chuàn chuàn xiāng kěyǐ qūhán.
examples.english: In winter, a bowl of steamy skewered hot pot can ward off the cold.
